transcript_chunks.text: the uncharted movie is okay look if mark wahlberg sully angers you the movie's not gonna change your mind but for everyone else there is a surprisingly competent two hours of adventure banter and twist that adequately translate the adrenaline pumping highs the playstation series is known for but i'd say more importantly it never hits any truly eye rolling lows unfortunately video game movies continue to insist not fully embracing their iconic soundtracks and while the classic uncharted theme is used a couple times too admittedly dope effect these moments just remind me how painfully generic and uncharted the rest of the score is but tom holland is fun as hell to watch as this version of nathan drake the supporting cast is engaging enough to get from one macguffin to the next and the one unique set piece not borrowed from the games feels very uncharted and it's honestly pretty rad you can hear our in-depth review on the new episode of the kind of funny screencast but in short is this a

set piece not borrowed from the games feels very uncharted and it's honestly pretty rad you can hear our in-depth review on the new episode of the kind of funny screencast but in short is this a glowing endorsement no do i think you need to rush out to a theater to see uncharted no but did the entire grouper i was with walk out saying eh i'm kind of excited to see a sequel yeah and that goes to show
